messages.message: Where should we create pages in Confluence for information about a feature of the Instabase product? It doesnt seem very clear, even the `Product` space doesnt have any documentation on the product itself, seems to be mostly about use cases and process
For context, I am trying to figure out where to document SDLC
@Aaron Vontell I like the idea of using Jira for documenting product features. You can attach any google doc to the issue.
I was trying to stay away from Google Docs as I thought our initial goal was to move away from Google Docs and use Confluence instead?
^ mixing the two, at least for me, seems to slow things down as I need to search in two places instead of one for information
Maybe this is also based on the way I use Jira - I usually create a new epic for each version of the product feature, and so not sure if that would work well with putting the product info in one spot

@Aaron Vontell I am peering through the lens of discoverability and agility, and of course my past experience. I've used workflows that can show Jira issues on a Confluence page (https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/use-jira-applications-and-confluence-together-427623543.html), but mostly I've just used Jira for product feature development. We have integration between Jira and Confluence wiki (https://confluence.atlassian.com/confeval/confluence-evaluator-resources/confluence-jira-integration-features) pages.

In my past work lives, we've used Confluence as a place to park big ideas, team-wide pages, and the wiki pages themselves served as a portal. For me, product features that go in product releases have always been tracked in Jira issues.  Your question is a good one. Jira is not perfect, but it is designed for product development workflows and we can improve our efficiency with thoughtful process understanding.
I think that makes sense! What if it is not necessarily product development though, and rather product motivation, vision, and history?
hey @Aaron Vontell you can work with me and @Jesika Haria to reorganize Confluence. I think I understand what you are saying

ahhh strategic management... (I think this is where the GitHubbers will have memories of using GitHub Issues effectively).

Wherever this knowledge goes, it can link to a Jira issue for the product feature.

Thanks @Justin!!

Hey Aaron, super fair ask - what I’ve done in the past is document in the actual engineering team spaces but that might not be the right approach going forward. Just reorganized the product confluence page, so it’s a fresh topic. we can set up some time to work together on this!
